TopicTitle: Bug when loading workspace: vehicle under the floor

Articles.Content:
When loading workspace with some vessels I created, the vessels are under the floor and I've not yet fount a way to take them out. There is not more a root part and if I try to drag the crew cupola (the previous root part), it detach from everything else. And also all the other parts looks to be detached one from another...

Has anyone encountered this bug and found a way to recover the vehicle?

Same problem. Haven’t figured out a workaround. It occurs every time the thing loads after recovery. When I load it at the launch pad it works fine for flight, but when it loads in the VAB, even on a revert from flight. I get a bunch of detached parts under the floor. Attempting to rotate the camera or move some of the parts can lock the camera in place or even change the color scheme. My uneducated guess is from the lighting engine interacting with what should be an out of bounds area. Your picture is pretty representative. My craft was a squat lander I was testing. Vessel height may be relevant. I also moved the vertical position of the workspace upward before building originally, so that may have something to do with it also. This did not happen to me until I actually recovered the vessel after flight.

Edited February 26, 2023 by Belshee
